pageContext.claim: “Right now, in a number of states, the laws allow a baby to be born [sic] from his or her mother's womb in the ninth month. It is wrong. It has to change.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump meant to say torn, not born, but he's speaking about something that does not happen. All but seven states have  prohibitions on gestational limits, from 20 to 24 weeks, or the point of “viability." Indeed, only 1.3 percent of abortions—about 8,500 a year– take place at or after 21 weeks. (Full term is considered between 37-42 weeks.) Taking a baby out of the womb in the 9th month is a c-section, so maybe Trump's slip of the tongue was appropriate.
